description: Residential and commercial air conditioning demand response program. Central cooling systems are cycled on/off every 15 minutes during high demand periods. Excludes window units and ductless mini-split units. Company provides and installs control receiver at no charge to participant.

service_territories: Otter Tail Power Company South Dakota service territory

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Residential customers must be on Residential, Farm, or Residential Demand Control Rate. Commercial customers must be on General Service or Small General Service meter. Commercial eligibility based on tons of connected cooling load.

penalty_structure.penalty_description: Company reserves right to deny or cancel enrollment

nomination_bidding.bidding_structure: Fixed payment program with no bidding

special_attributes: Commercial two-stage units: one stage fully off, other stage permitted to operate

historical_events.notes: Multi-city event including Bemidji, Crookston, Devils Lake, Fergus Falls, Garrison, Jamestown, Karlstad, Langdon, Milbank, Morris, Oakes, Rugby, Toronto, Wahpeton. Multiple control types activated: Water Heating (25-84 minutes), Thermal Storage (76-80 minutes), Dual Fuel Programs, and Residential Demand Control. Note: This event was observed on the Current and Recent Energy Control page on 2025-10-12.

data_sources.source_name: Otter Tail Power Company CoolSavings Program Page
Otter Tail Power Company Current and Recent Energy Control
Otter Tail Power Company South Dakota Rates, Rules, and Regulations

integration_metadata.battery_suitability_explanation: This program is exclusively for air conditioning load control (residential central AC, air-source heat pumps, and geothermal heat pumps). Battery energy storage systems are NOT eligible. The program uses direct load control to cycle AC equipment on/off every 15 minutes during peak demand. No provisions exist for battery participation, charging, or discharging. This is identical to the Minnesota CoolSavings program (Index 50) - residential AC cycling only.
integration_metadata.revenue_calculation_methodology: N/A - Battery systems are not eligible for this program
integration_metadata.notes: BATTERY SUITABILITY: N/A - AC load control program only. PAYMENT STRUCTURE: Residential customers receive $8.25/month during June-September (4 months = $33/year maximum per household). Commercial customers receive $6/ton of connected cooling/month during the same period. ELIGIBILITY: Requires central cooling system with exterior disconnect box. Excludes window units and ductless mini-splits. Company installs control receiver at no cost. LIMITATIONS FOR BATTERY ANALYSIS: No battery participation possible. This is a legacy direct load control program targeting residential and small commercial AC loads only. DATA QUALITY: Limited historical event data publicly available. Only one recent event (October 2025) was found, which occurred outside the typical June-September season, suggesting the program may also activate during shoulder months. No multi-year event statistics publicly available. Tariff document 14.08 (Air Conditioning Control Rider) referenced but PDF not accessible via web search.
